tweets.text:
The ùïè recommendation system is evolving very rapidly. We are aiming for deletion of all heuristics within 4 to 6 weeks.

Grok will literally read every post and watch every video (100M+ per day) to match users with content they‚Äôre most likely to find interesting. 

This should address the new user or small account problem, where you post something great, but nobody sees it. 

We will also be adding the ability for you to adjust your feed temporarily or permanently just by asking Grok.

quoted.text:
How the ùïè algorithm really works?

The algorithm doesn‚Äôt boost or hide posts randomly, it just tries to figure out if your post will be interesting to people.

That means:

If you post a plain link with no words, the algorithm doesn‚Äôt have much to judge, so it won‚Äôt show it to many people.

But if you add a good caption, image, or more context, it spreads more.

Basically, the algorithm needs enough info to understand why your post matters, just like a human would.

tweets.text: üéØ

quoted.text:
Everything Elon Musk clarified today about the ùïè algorithm powered by Grok:

‚Ä¢ X‚Äôs recommendation system is evolving fast, all old heuristics will be deleted within 4‚Äì6 weeks.

‚Ä¢ The new system will rely fully on AI powered by Grok.

‚Ä¢ Grok will read every post and watch over 100M+ videos per day to learn what users find interesting.

‚Ä¢ Its goal is to match each user with content they‚Äôre most likely to enjoy or engage with.

‚Ä¢ This will help fix the small or new account problem, where good posts often go unseen.

‚Ä¢ You‚Äôll soon be able to ask Grok directly to adjust your feed, either temporarily or permanently.

‚Ä¢ Elon clarified that the algorithm does not randomly boost or hide posts.

‚Ä¢ It simply assesses which posts are likely to interest users, similar to how a human judges content.

‚Ä¢ Posts with bare links or little context will have weaker distribution and the posts with strong, interesting descriptions or images will get better visibility.

‚Ä¢ The system‚Äôs only goal is to show users the most relevant and engaging content.
